.x0 .y0 .w1 .h1}

::: {.c .x0 .y1 .w1 .h2}
::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h3 .y2 .ff1 .fs0 .fc0 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
unix4lyfe.org[»[Time]{.ff2}]{.fc1}
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y3 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Somenotesabouttime:
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .y4 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
UTC:Thetimeatzerodegreeslongitude(thePrimeMeridian)iscalled
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y5 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
CoordinatedUniversalTime(UTCis[acompromise]{.fc0}betweentheFrenchandEnglish
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y6 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
initialisms)
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .y7 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
GMT:UTCusedtobecalledGreenwichMeanTime(GMT)becausethePrime
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y8 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Meridianwas(arbitrarily)chosentopassthroughtheRoyalObservatoryin
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y9 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Greenwich.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .ya .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
OthertimezonescanbewrittenasanoffsetfromUTC.AustralianEasternStandard
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .yb .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
TimeisUTC+1000.e.g.10:00UTCis20:00ESTonthesameday.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .yc .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
DaylightsavingdoesnotaffectUTC.It\'sjustapolitydecidingtochangeits
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .yd .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
timezone(offsetfromUTC).Forexample,GMTisstillused:it\'stheBritishnational
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .ye .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
timezoneinwinter.InsummeritbecomesBST.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .yf .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Leapseconds:Byinternationalconvention,UTC(whichisanarbitraryhuman
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y10 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
invention)iskeptwithin0.9secondsofphysicalreality(UT1,whichisameasureof
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y11 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
solartime)byintroducinga\"leapsecond\"inthelastminuteoftheUTCyear,orin
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y12 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
thelastminuteofJune.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y13 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Leapsecondsdon\'thavetobeannouncedmuchmorethansixmonthsbeforethey
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y14 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
happen.Thisisaproblemifyouneedsecond-accurateplanningbeyondsixmonths.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .y15 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Unixtime:Measuredasthenumberofsecondssinceepoch(thebeginningof
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h3 .y16 .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
1970inUTC).Unixtimeisnotaffectedbytimezonesordaylightsaving.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y17 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
AccordingtoPOSIX.1,Unixtimeissupposedtohandlealeapsecondbyreplaying
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y18 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
theprevioussecond.e.g.:
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y19 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.00
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1a .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.25
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1b .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.50
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1c .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.75
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1d .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.00←replay
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1e .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.25
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y1f .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.50
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y20 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
59.75
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y21 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
00.00←increment
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y22 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
00.25
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y23 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Thisisatrade-off:youcan\'trepresentaleapsecond,andyourtimeisguaranteedtogo
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y24 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
backwards.Ontheotherhand,everydayhasexactly86,400seconds,andyoudon\'tneeda
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y25 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
tableofallpreviousandfutureleapsecondsinordertoformatUnixtimeashuman-preferred
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y26 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
hours-minutes-seconds.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y27 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Seealso:mywrite-uponthe[2012leapsecond]{.fc0},alongwithlogsfromseveralsystems
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y28 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
showingthereplaybehavioraswellasGoogle\'s\"[leapsmear]{.fc0}.\"
:::
:::

[](http://unix4lyfe.org/){.l}

::: {.d .m1 style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:56.003025px;bottom:770.239010px;width:65.282902px;height:14.257210px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"}
:::

[](http://www.nist.gov/pml/div688/utcnist.cfm#cut){.l}

::: {.d .m1 style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:276.614200px;bottom:716.211790px;width:75.037840px;height:14.257200px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"}
:::

[](http://unix4lyfe.org/leap-second/){.l}

::: {.d .m1 style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:254.853240px;bottom:103.903198px;width:87.794250px;height:14.257202px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"}
:::

[](http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/09/time-technology-and-leaping-seconds.html){.l}

::: {.d .m1 style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:334.393340px;bottom:85.894104px;width:54.777590px;height:14.257202px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"}
:::
:::

::: {.pc .pc2 .w0 .h0}
![](data:image/png;base64,){.bi
.x0 .y0 .w1 .h1}

::: {.c .x0 .y1 .w1 .h2}
::: {.t .m0 .x4 .h5 .y29 .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
ntpd can be configured with the [leapfile]{.fc0} directive to announce
an upcoming leap
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h5 .y2a .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
second. Most leaf installations don\'t bother with this, and rely on
enough of their
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h5 .y2b .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
upstreams getting it right.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y2c .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Sometime-relatedconsiderationswhenprogramming:
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h3 .y2d .ff2 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Timezonesareapresentation-layerproblem!
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y2e .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Mostofyourcodeshouldn\'tbedealingwithtimezonesorlocaltime,itshouldbepassingUnix
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y2f .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
timearound.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x4 .h5 .y30 .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
libc and/or your language\'s runtime has code to do timezone conversions
and
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h5 .y31 .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
formatting. This stuff is tricky, avoid re-implementing it yourself.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y32 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Whenmeasuringanintervaloftime,useamonotonic(alwaysincreasing)clock.Read
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y33 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
the[clock\_gettime()]{.ff3}manpage.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y34 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Whenrecordingapointintime,measureUnixtime.It\'sUTC.It\'seasytoobtain.It
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y35 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
doesn\'thavetimezoneoffsetsordaylightsaving(orleapseconds).
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y36 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Whenstoringatimestamp,storeUnixtime.It\'sasinglenumber.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y37 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Ifyouwanttostoreahumanly-readabletime(e.g.logs),considerstoringit
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y38 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Unixtime,not[ ]{._ ._0}Unixtime.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y39 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Whendisplayingtime,alwaysincludethetimezoneoffset.Atimeformatwithoutan
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y3a .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
offsetisuseless.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y3b .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Thesystemclockisinaccurate.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y3c .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
You\'reonanetwork?Everyothersystem\'sclockisdifferentlyinaccurate.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y3d .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Thesystemclockcan,andwill,jumpbackwardsandforwardsintimeduetothings
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y3e .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
outsideofyourcontrol.Yourprogramshouldbedesignedtosurvivethis.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y3f .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Thenumberof\[clock\]secondsper\[real\]secondisbothinaccurateandvariable.It
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y40 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
mostlyvarieswithtemperature.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x4 .h5 .y41 .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
ntpd can change the system time in two ways:
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x5 .h4 .y42 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Step:makingtheclockjumpbackwardsorforwardstothecorrecttime
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x6 .h4 .y43 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
instantaneously.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x5 .h4 .y44 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Slew:changingthefrequencyoftheclocksothatitslowlydriftstowardthe
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x6 .h4 .y45 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
correcttime.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y46 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Slewispreferredbecauseit\'slessdisruptive,butit\'sonlyusefulforcorrectingsmalloffsets.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y47 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Specialmentions:
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y48 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Timepassesatarateofonesecondpersecondforeveryobserver.Thefrequencyof
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y49 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
aremoteclockrelativetoanobserverisaffectedbyvelocityandgravity.Theclocksinside
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y4a .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
GPSsatellitesareadjustedforrelativisticeffects.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x2 .h4 .y4b .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
MySQL(atleast4.xand5.x)storesthe[DATETIME]{.ff3}typeasabinaryencodingofits[\"YYYY-]{.ff3}
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y4c .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
MM-DD
HH:MM:SS\"[string.Itdoesnotstoreanoffset,andinterpretstimesaccordingto]{.ff1}
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x3 .h4 .y4d .ff3 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
@\@session.time\_zone[:]{.ff1}
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y4e .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
mysql\>insertintotimesvalues(now());
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y4f .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
mysql\>selectunix\_timestamp(t)fromtimes;
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y50 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
1310128044
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y51 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
mysql\>SETSESSIONtime\_zone=\'+0:00\';
:::
:::

[](http://support.ntp.org/bin/view/Support/ConfiguringNTP#Section_6.14.){.l}

::: {.d .m1 style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:273.612700px;bottom:777.742800px;width:42.021180px;height:10.505310px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"}
:::

.x0 .y52 .w1 .h6}

::: {.c .x0 .y53 .w1 .h7}
::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y54 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
mysql\>selectunix\_timestamp(t)fromtimes;
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y55 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
1310164044
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y56 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
There\'salsoa[TIMESTAMP]{.ff3}type,which[ ]{._
._1}storedasUNIXtime,buthasothermagic.
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y57 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
Inconclusion,ifyoucareatallaboutstoringtimestampsinMySQL,storethem[
]{._ ._2}and
:::

::: {.t .m0 .x1 .h4 .y58 .ff1 .fs0 .fc1 .sc0 .ls0 .ws0}
usethe[UNIX\_TIMESTAMP()]{.ff3}and[FROM\_UNIXTIME()]{.ff3}functions.
:::

:::
